fields.description: Need the ability to modify Stash logo and background color like JIRA Look and Feel
fields.summary: Provide ability to customize Stash's look and feel

fields.description:
In reviewing your product it was found to be non-compliant in several areas. As part of the US Government we request remediation strategy be developed. The following conditions were found to be non-compliant with accessibility issues: 1. Software must provide a visual indication of where the keyboard focus is on the screen and provide this information to assistance technology. Examples of non-compliance: User loses visual focus on the Commit file link. 508 Standard - (Software Applications and Operating Systems) - c (Input Focus) Recommend resolution: Use a standard operating system call to generate a focus rectangle on a button or highlighted cell within a grid. Expose the focus of the current control when Windows operating system is used for focus. 2. Images and graphics require a text description for screen reader users. For decorative images that do not convey information, use ALT="". Examples of non-compliance: Various visual indicators/icons are missing alt tags, i.e. magnifier icon, up arrow icon and profile icon. The STASH logo is missing an alt tag. 508 standard - 1194.22 (Web-based Intranet and Internet Information and Applications) - a (Text Equivalents) Recommended resolution: Use ALT attribute with descriptive text. For example . 3. All form fields must be labeled so screen reader users can complete and submit the forms. The question (and response where appropriate) must be announced so users know what information to enter. Examples of non-compliance: Missing LABEL or TITLE for Groups filter input box. Missing LABEL/ID or TITLE for Master Branches input box. Missing LABEL/ID or TITLE for Pull Request HTTP input box. 508 standard - 1194.22 (Web-based Intranet and Internet Information and Applications) - n (Form Labels) Recommended resolution: Single labels (question):LABEL/ID: or FIELDSET/LEGEND and LABEL/ID:
Include plan?
4. No method provided to skip repetitive links in application. This would allow keyboard and screen reader users to navigate quickly past the navigation links on the page. 508 standard - 1194.22 (Web-based Intranet and Internet Information and Applications) - o (Skip Navigation) Recommended resolution: Best practice example: www.ready.gov/america
fields.summary: Accessibility for visually impaired, ADA

fields.description: Stash allow to change avatar for repo, but disallow revert to standard cool icon. Since you changed ison you get no chance to return cool standard icon for repo.
fields.summary: Reset project avatar to default

fields.description:
MySQL 5.6.10 represents the first GA release of 5.6. However, it cannot be used with Stash due to a [serious issue|http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=68424] with its query optimizer.

This issue has 2 deliverables:
- Monitor the MySQL bug for a fix version and validate it
- Deploy an image with the fixed version to the build farm and add it to the DAO matrix tests to validate 5.6 support going forward

Until a version including a fix for that issue is specified, 5.6 cannot be used by Stash, and will not be supported if deployed at customer sites. Stash 2.2 includes changes, made under STASH-3133, which will block attempts to start Stash when connected to MySQL 5.6, as well as to block attempts to migrate from HSQL to MySQL 5.6 or setup MySQL 5.6 as the external database.

Customers interested in using MySQL 5.6 with Stash may track this issue for status, as well as the referenced MySQL bug.

Note: This bug also precludes the use of Amazon Aurora, which as of 2017-03-31 is based on MySQL 5.6.10a
fields.summary: Add MySQL 5.6 to test matrix
Driver not available when running Stash as Windows service using $STASH_HOME/lib
Pull Request REST resource returns only pull requests in an OPEN state
Developer Toolbox > Atlassian Stash REST Plugin missing parameters

fields.description:
When configured to allow SSH access, the REST API still reports http-based clone url's rather than SSH-ones.

Personally I much prefer SSH clone url's over HTTP ones, so it would be very nice to have the REST API be able to retrieve this information on a Stash instance in which SSH is configured.
fields.summary: Include SSH clone url's in REST API

fields.description:
Why waste place on the list of repositories on repositories page?

Would be nice to see some additional columns beside plain repository name:

* Cloning address of repository
* Description of repository (for example first line of the "README"-file) ...

More info might be useful - would be nice if project admin would be able to configure, which columns to be displayed in which order ...
fields.summary: Display more info on Repository-List

fields.description: Double html escaped by the looks of things.
fields.summary: Apostrophes in commit messages not rendered correctly in pull request emails.

fields.description: Lack of intelligent word wrapping on the Projects and Repositories pages results in line breaks occuring in the middle of words, which looks unprofessional. Please refer to the attached screen shot for an example.
fields.summary: Improve column width layout for project and repository listings

fields.description:
Stash does sub-line diffing (darker shade of red/green for the specific characters that changed), which is awesome. However, once someone has commented on a line, that whole line has a blue background, which is annoying. Especially so when the change is something non-obvious, like trailing whitespace (see attached screenshot).

Would it be possible to have commented-on lines still show the sub-line diff, perhaps using a darker shade of blue?
fields.summary: As a pull request user, I'd like to see sub-line diffs even on lines that somebody has commented on

fields.description:
Need more context for reviews/diffs! Preferably option to have full context.

When a comment is added to a line, that line gets highlighted blue - very hard to determine what was changed etc. ie. Can only tell if it has been added/modified if it has a '+' in the gutter, or removed if it has '\-' (and the +/\- isn't immediately clear, need to actually look for it)
fields.summary: Implement expandable diff context

Maybe you find it useful.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

I'm excited to share that in Bitbucket Server 7.0 we shipped redesigned and optimized pull request page with several improvements you’ve been asking us for a long time. One of the improvements is the new tasks, which can now be created without parent comment. New tasks essentially are resolvable comments.

Please, don't hesitate to leave feedback on the feature in the comments below. We would like to know if new tasks solve your problems. 

You can find more information in the Bitbucket Server 7.0 [release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-0-release-notes-990546638.html] and Pull Requests [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/review-and-discuss-a-pull-request-808488540.html].

Anton Genkin
 Product Manager Bitbucket Server
{panel}
*Original description*

While Pull Request is in progress then users make some comments with always the same types. Like:
 1. Thanks, will fix it.
 2. Fixed
 3. Agree, +1, etc
 4. Disagree, -1, etc
 5. Good code, Thumb!, etc

Will nice to have API to attach some meta information to comments. Such as karma-points, smiles, statuses (Fixed, Thanks, Readed, Accepted, etc).
fields.summary: A comment can be marked as done/actioned

fields.description: If file in Pull Request have conflict on merge, then Stash make them yellow and draw Conflict Marker Lines. But it also numbered it. Line 64 on screenshot is virtual. Stash must not assign number to it.
fields.summary: Conflict separator affected on line numbers within Stash Diff viewer

fields.description:
Feature Request:

Make columnwidth for columns "Project-Key-Description" on Projects-Page resizeable. Lengthy projectnames and projectkeys lead to ugly unneeded linebreaks on widescreen monitors ...

Hey,

in our company different departments using Stash. It would be nice to categorize some projects for a better overview.

fields.description:
My Repo within STASH has a camelcase name for readability reasons. (for example AbCdEf)

The generated HTTP-URL for the repo within the STASH-Interface transforms the reponame to lowercase. (for example: http://jok@stash.anywhere.com/scm/TEST/abcfef.git)

Using this URL to clone the repository leads to lowercase foldername "abcdef" (on local machine).

This is annoying, since the generated folder name should correspond the exact camelcase name (mostly for readability reasons)!
fields.summary: Camelcase Reponame converted to lowercase in URL

fields.description: !http://monosnap.com/image/3ebZaEySF4gsoZtT7FHjT49J6.png! Looking at the raw email, this is just a : {noformat} docs / src / site / markdown / how-tos / repo-hook-examples / pre-receive-branch-config.md {noformat} But {{pre-receive-branch-config.md}} must somehow look like a link to gmail, so it marks it up. The link 404s obviously. (At least until I create a file called cheap-cialis.ru)

Doc Task - Update - Running Stash as a Windows service

fields.description:
When a user has insufficient branch permissions to merge a pull request, the merge button is greyed out and an icon presents a longer description in the tooltip telling you why you can't merge.

When a user has insufficient repository permissions (i.e. they are only an observer) to merge a pull request, the merge button is not shown at all and no other indication or explanation is given.

We should change the observer to present the same as branch permissions.
fields.summary: UI presents insufficient branch and repo perms differently

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status – May 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Bitbucket Server/Data Center 7.13 ([release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-data-center-and-server-7-13-release-notes-1056675425.html]) adds tags to the source selector when creating pull requests, and also enables the "Create pull request" button on the compare view when the source is a tag. When merging a pull request whose source is a tag, the "Delete ... after merging" checkbox will be disabled. Only source branches can be deleted on merge.

The _target_ selector still does not allow tags, and on the compare view the "Create pull request" button is still disabled when the target is a tag. This will likely never change, because merging a pull request modifies the target and Git tags are intended to be _immutable_.

The _source and target_ selectors still do not allow specific commits, and that's also unlikely to ever change. Pull requests _generally_ include some amount of rework, which isn't possible if the pull request starts from a specific commit. Allowing it would also require substantial changes to both our API and the implementation code, both of which are heavily coupled to working with refs. Feel free to share use cases, if you have them, but the likely response will remain to either create a branch or tag on the commit you want to merge and use that.

Best regards,
 Bryan Turner - Principal Developer
 Bitbucket Data Center
{panel}
*Original suggestion*

Some branch maintenance requires the ability to pull from an annotated tag (such as in the case of a QA certified commit) to downstream branches (our branchmasters use stash for convenience). Please consider including a tab in the "source" combo box choice for tags as well as branches.
fields.summary: Allow Pull Requests to source from a tag as well as a branch

fields.description: To enforce a review workflow, Stash users may require that a certain number of people approve a pull request before it is able to be merged.
fields.summary: Disable merging until a set number of people have approved the pull request

In fact, I can't see anywhere the *Application title* is used.

fields.description:
On 'rebase with rename workflow' for conflict resolving on pull requests, previously created pull request is declined, new pull request is raised. But then you will delete old branch (it for declined pull request), then Stash can't do nothing with declined pull request. No reopen it, no delete (STASH-3134).

API changes for this will also nice, to have it enabled by plugin.
fields.summary: Automatically deletion of declined pull requests with based on deleted branch

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of April 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

The ability for pull request authors and repository administrators to delete pull requests is under active development for inclusion in an upcoming release of Bitbucket Server. This issue will be closed with a fix version indicating which release includes the change, once it has passed review and QA. We appreciate your patience.

Best regards,
Bryan Turner
Atlassian Bitbucket
{panel}

Some pull requests created by mistake may be deleted, not declined. Bitbucket Sever should allow deleting pull requests.
fields.summary: Ability to delete Pull Requests

fields.description:
Stash 2.1.2 installation with MySQL is failing with this exception:
{noformat}
The schema could not be created.
com.atlassian.stash.internal.migration.DefaultMigrationHelper.createSchema(DefaultMigrationHelper.java:117)
com.atlassian.stash.internal.migration.AbstractMigrationMaintenanceTask.setup(AbstractMigrationMaintenanceTask.java:195)
com.atlassian.stash.internal.maintenance.ActiveMaintenanceTaskContext.setup(ActiveMaintenanceTaskContext.java:166)
...
Migration failed for change set liquibase/r1_3/m01.xml::STASHDEV-1023-10::bturner:
Reason: liquibase.exception.DatabaseException: Error executing SQL CREATE INDEX `idx_sta_diff_comment_anchors` ON `stash`.`sta_diff_comment_anchor`(`to_hash`, `file_path`, `from_hash`): Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes:
Caused By: Error executing SQL CREATE INDEX `idx_sta_diff_comment_anchors` ON `stash`.`sta_diff_comment_anchor`(`to_hash`, `file_path`, `from_hash`): Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes:
Caused By: Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes
liquibase.changelog.ChangeSet.execute(ChangeSet.java:347)
liquibase.changelog.visitor.UpdateVisitor.visit(UpdateVisitor.java:27)
liquibase.changelog.ChangeLogIterator.run(ChangeLogIterator.java:58)
...
Error executing SQL CREATE INDEX `idx_sta_diff_comment_anchors` ON `stash`.`sta_diff_comment_anchor`(`to_hash`, `file_path`, `from_hash`): Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes
liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.execute(JdbcExecutor.java:62)
liquibase.executor.jvm.JdbcExecutor.execute(JdbcExecutor.java:104)
liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase.execute(AbstractDatabase.java:1091)
...
Specified key was too long; max key length is 767 bytes
sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:39)
sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:27)
{noformat}
This has been reported on MySQL 5.6
This seems to have exceeded the [Innodb limit|http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/innodb-restrictions.html] of 767 bytes (40, 1024, 40) for (`to_hash`, `file_path`, `from_hash`).
fields.summary: Stash 2.1.2 failing with MySQL 5.6 due to "specified key was too long" error

fields.description:
Currently stash supports README.md and README.txt
It would be nice if it could support all the formats that GitHub does. This would make migrated from GitHub to Stash easier.

Ones on the top of my list would be:
README = text file. So should only be a few minutes of work
README.rdoc  This will take a bit more work :)
fields.summary: More formats supported for README files

fields.description:

This might also be true for other combinations of README files, haven't tested that.
fields.summary: README not displayed if both README & README.md exist

fields.description:
As far i know, the Pull Request is simple reference in refs/pulls space. Will be nice to support follow scenario of conflicts resolving:
1. User create Pull Request from branch 'feature' to 'master'.
2. After review branch feature can't be merged cos of conflict
3. User make:
{code}
$ git fetch
$ git checkout feature
$ git rebase master
# Resolve conflicts
$ git branch -M feature/1
$ git push origin feature/1
{code}

Then (and for now) user must decline old pull request and create new one. But maybe his wand just to change reference to branch of pull request.

This feature look like follow conflict resolution:
{code}
$ git fetch
$ git checkout feature
$ git rebase master
# Resolve conflicts
$ git push -f origin feature
{code}

Here branch is not renamed, but {{push -f}} is used. This maybe dangerous, if branch feature is on work of several developers, not a single one.
fields.summary: Allow to change branch of Pull Request (support for rebase with renaming scenario)

fields.description: If author of Pull Request want to take a time to fix Pull Request a more little bit with few commits, then his must press 'Hand-brake' button, and until his unpressed it, Pull Request can't be merged by someone of reviewers, even if all of them approved Pull Request.
fields.summary: Hand-brake for Pull Request to allow author temporary deny Merging

fields.description:
If commit add new line, or delete line, then diff show red/green squares ignoring whitespaces. And this look not so good. In this case better to use solid background. It will be easy to read/review.

You can see this at screenshot (attached)

This highlight is great for partially changed lines, but if line changed totally, it make difficult to review such commits.
fields.summary: Do not show diff darker read/green region of changes within diff if line totally changed
Search through an entire project, not just a repository
Unable to upload avatar on create project screen with PROJECT_CREATE
Support Tool incorrectly signals successful Support Request creation

fields.description:
We're making a plugin that will keep Stash Git repositories in sync with Subversion repository. This plugin uses SubGit. 

It all works fine, except for merge of pull requests. The problem is that SubGit expects all new commits to come via client pushes and pre-receive hook to be called. Then SubGit has a chance to reject users commit in case there are incoming changes from Subversion.

With merge operation, hooks are not called and Git repository goes out of sync with Subversion repository.

What we need for SubGit plugin to function properly:

1) call a plugin's hook before updating branch reference to the newly integrated commits from the pull request;
2) let plugin's hook reject that merge commit (in case there are incoming changes from Subversion being translated to Git commits and pull request have to be merged again).

Alternatively, as a fallback, plugin should be able to disable pull requests feature for repository it keeps in sync with Subversion.
fields.summary: API to hook into pull request merge process.

fields.description:
{code}
$ wget -O - 'http://stash.acme.com/'
--2013-02-14 15:27:32--  http://stash.acme.com/
Resolving stash.acme.com... [skipped]
Connecting to stash.acme.com|xx.xx.xx.xx|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 302 Found
Location: https://stash.acme.com/login [following]
--2013-02-14 15:27:32--  https://stash.acme.com/login
Connecting to stash.acme.com|xx.xx.xx.xx|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 6056 (5.9K) [text/html]
Saving to: ‘STDOUT’
{code}

See what happened:
1. Browser send GET on HTTP (80 port), cookies does not send, cos cookies is setup for HTTPS domain.
2. Stash not found {{remember_me}} and session cookie and send redirect to {{/login}}.
3. Tomcat forward HTTP to HTTPS.

As result user have page on HTTPS domain, with valid session cookies, but Stash show him 'Login' page as his is not logged in.

Also see STASH-3118 — it for the same error but from other side.
fields.summary: HTTP 302 Redirect from HTTP to HTTPS is possible invalid

fields.description:
When people are creating pull request, they don't necessary know who should approve the request.
It should be nice to be able to define default reviewers for pull reuqest by project.
fields.summary: It should be nice to have a default reviewer for pull request

fields.description:
Browsers such as Chrome/Firefox has a great feature 'Omnibox'. This great feature save for typed prefix 'stash' first visible address — stash.acme.com/login. Then user type 'stash' and press Enter his always get this page opened. And start to thing, that his is not a logged in, but this is just login form. If you then erase 'login' from URL and press Enter, you get Logged In stash Welcome Page.

The solution is redirect back into Stash root URL, or draw on login page something like 'Hey, you already logged in, mate. Best regards to Omnibox of your browser'.
fields.summary: Do not show login form for logged in users

fields.description:
We have a few hundred users and dozens of projects in our Stash instance, and we expect it to become even bigger.

To encourage collaboration and innovation all developers can see all projects, so it's quite a long list of projects.

It would be nice to be able to group projects so that it's easier to find a certain project, and it would also be easier on the eye.

The group names should be completely customizable of course.

Example use cases: Grouping projects by area/subject, companies, departments, operating systems, platforms or programming languages.
fields.summary: Grouping of Stash Projects

fields.description:
This will most likely be a change in the platform (see https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/REST-231) so we should only need to update to a new version that contains the fix.

This was triggered by https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-56012
fields.summary: Allow JSONP to be disabled as it is a CSRF vulnerability

fields.description: I'm irrationally annoyed by the badge not disappearing when I've done my last pull request.
fields.summary: Update inbox badge when approving pull requests

fields.description:
Limiting the project list to 25 when there are only a few more than that causes a number of minor, but noticeable issues:
* A visual delay and interruption when scrolling for just a few more entries
* The possibility of missing that there are more when not completely scrolled (though could trigger earlier to avoid this)
* Limited efficacy of Ctrl-F browser find to locate a project (by name or description) before scrolling

Not all users make a habit of using the repo search for a combination reasons (including preference and also limitations in how it how it works). To that end, the project list should serve its purpose more fully.
fields.summary: Increase the number of projects initially shown on the project list from 25 to 100

fields.description: Then you create Pull Request, Stash collect all commit messages and construct large description. But it format it as Markdown syntax, which look not good. Better if Stash by default will wrap commit messages into {{```}} monospaced snippets.
fields.summary: Use markdown code blocks for autogenerated Pull Request descriptions

fields.description:
It would be nice to support custom linkers which creates links to resources based on patterns.

For example:

SOMEPROJECT-[0-9]+ => https://jira.acme.com/$0
BTS-[0-9]+ => https://bts.acme.com/$0
etc
fields.summary: Support custom linkers

fields.description:
USE CASE:

We've got quite a few projects within stash and a lot of repositories in each project. 

SCENARIO I: As core developer I'm member of many of those projects - and I've lost the overview where a certain repository is located.
SCENARIO II: As STASH-administrator a lot of colleagues ask me: "Where is repository xxx is located?"

Therefore I'm looking for an EASY way to get any information where the searched repository is located.

FEATURE REQUEST:

* Comfortable possibility within stash to find a repository by name (beside opening all projects and searching within each project - which I really won't call comfortable ...)

* Finding repositories even if I'm not yet member of the project hosting the repository? (so I can identify the project I have to get the rights ...)
fields.summary: Finding a certain repository

fields.description:
When a user with {{PROJECT_CREATE}} permission tries to create a project with an avatar, they receive the following error when submitting the form:

bq. You are not permitted to access this resource

*Workaround*
The user must create a project without an avatar, and upload the avatar when the project has been created.
fields.summary: Creating a project fails when uploading an avatar if user is not Admin or Sysadmin

fields.description:
During stash stop this following warning is displayed:

WARNING: Problem with directory [/home/stash/atlassian-stash-data/lib], exists: [false], isDirectory: [false], canRead: [false]
Feb 07, 2013 11:09:22 AM org.apache.catalina.startup.ClassLoaderFactory validateFile
WARNING: Problem with directory [/home/stash/atlassian-stash-data/lib], exists: [false], isDirectory: [false], canRead: [false]

Is this WARNING safe to ignore?

Thanks
fields.summary: WARNING: Problem with directory [/home/stash/atlassian-stash-data/lib], exists: [false], isDirectory: [false], canRead: [false]

fields.description:
As per the supported platforms page

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Supported+platforms

only Oracle JDK is supported on Linux.

Considering that Oracle JDK is not available in the offical Linux repositories (in particular for Debian/Ubuntu), certifying under OpenJDK would offer customer an easier way to keep their Java versions secure.

Thanks
fields.summary: support for OpenJDK on Linux?

fields.description:
The download page

http://www.atlassian.com/software/stash/download

only offers 2.1.1.

Are these later version already published?

Thanks
fields.summary: Downloading Stash 2.2?

fields.description:
Stash supports different merge strategies for a pull request via config options in a properties file.

Provide a configuration option in the repository settings tab to turn this on or off.
fields.summary: Repository setting for merge strategy when merging a pull request

fields.description:
Stash supports turning off the {{--no-ff}} flag for pull request merges via a sekr3t config option.

Provide a configuration option in the repository settings tab to turn this on or off.
fields.summary: Repository setting for turning off --no-ff on pull request merges

fields.description: JIRA keys which are referenced in pull request description and comments should be automatically hyperlinked.
fields.summary: Automatically link JIRA keys in PR description and comments
Externalize common configuration options

fields.description:
The [supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Supported+platforms] page states that:
{quote}
If you are using Linux/UNIX: A dedicated user should be created to run Stash, as Stash runs as the user it is invoked under and therefore can potentially be abused.
Here is an example of how to create a dedicated user to run Stash in Linux:
$ sudo /usr/sbin/useradd --create-home --home-dir /usr/local/Stash --shell /bin/bash Stash
{quote}
This should be part of the normal installation process and integrated into:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Installing+Stash+on+Linux+and+Mac

Also a good idea to change the default umask to 077 for the user so that file isn't being read by every one
fields.summary: Add a note about running stash with a dedicated user on *nix platform to the installation docs

fields.description:
This document:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Transitioning+from+jTDS+to+Microsoft%27s+JDBC+driver
does not have any reference in the [upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Stash+upgrade+guide] or in the [SQL Server integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Connecting+Stash+to+SQL+Server] docs.
It might cause an issue during an upgrade, if users are not aware of how to set the db config manually:
{quote}
the system will lock on startup if the driver class and URL are not manually updated.
{quote}
fields.summary: Include a link to driver changes for SQL Server in the upgrade guide

fields.description: Currently we know this is not possible. The question is: will that be possible in the near future?
fields.summary: Delegate user and group management to JIRA OnDemand

fields.description: when navigating within the stash primary navigation links (files, commits, etc) the branch is not retained.
fields.summary: Branch not retained when navigating within stash

fields.description: Stash should respect {{.mailmap}} files in Git repositories.
fields.summary: Support .mailmap
Help in Pull Request promote wrong solution to merge with conflicts

fields.description:
README.md supports image URLs, but it seems only external URLs work. AFAICS, anyway.

If the image is in the same git repo and you use a relative name, Stash translates the image name to something like /projects/PROJECT/repos/repo-name/browse/doc/image.png, but doesn't find it when browsing the repository. This makes it impossible to create README.md files with images in a Stash git repo, unless there is some way to do it that I can't find in the docs.

But I don't want to use an absolute path because the same README then won't work when converted to HTML using the markdown program itself (which works fine with relative image names, btw).

Any ideas?
fields.summary: markdown: support displaying images in Stash repo

fields.description:
We have docs for changing context path but none for changing port number (which is a common scenario).
Can we please add this to existing docs?
fields.summary: Create documentation for changing port number

fields.description: The JIRA links when you open it have their links as {{#}} which means I can't middle click to open the issues in JIRA in new tabs. Can we allow that?
fields.summary: Pull request JIRA links won't open in a new tab

fields.description:
After switching to 2.1.0 in pom.xml, I cannot build our Stash plugin due to the following error: 

$ atlas-mvn eclipse:eclipse

....

Missing:
----------
1) com.atlassian.stash:stash-util:jar:1.1.0-SNAPSHOT

  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.

  Then, install it using the command:
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=com.atlassian.stash -DartifactId=stash-util -Dversion=1.1.0-SNAPSHOT -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file

  Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there:
      mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=com.atlassian.stash -DartifactId=stash-util -Dversion=1.1.0-SNAPSHOT -Dpackaging=jar -Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]

  Path to dependency:
        1) com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-stash-plugin:maven-plugin:4.1.4
        2) com.atlassian.stash:stash-util:jar:1.1.0-SNAPSHOT

----------
1 required artifact is missing.

for artifact:
  com.atlassian.maven.plugins:maven-stash-plugin:maven-plugin:4.1.4

from the specified remote repositories:
  atlassian-plugin-sdk (file://C:\Users\alex\atlassian-plugin-sdk/repository),
  central (http://repo1.maven.org/maven2),
  atlassian-public (https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public)
fields.summary: Can't build Stash plugin: com.atlassian.stash:stash-util:jar:1.1.0-SNAPSHOT not found
Regresion: Project list pagination is broken due to JavaScript error

fields.description:
Stash is missing proper logging mechanisms. I'm not saying about logging each GET/POST/PUT, but I'm talking about access control logging. Gitorious has something called Activities and I think something like this should be included in Stash. Administrators and project leaders/contributors etc. has to know who has access to what, who get access to which repository/branch etc.

To sum up:
- base log to the file (grep'able by admins) where actions like granting, revoking access to the repository/branch should be logged. (Date, who gave the access, who get the access and to what)
- later something like dashboard/activity list similar to Gitorious or Bitbucket's (afair bitbucket has something like that) shoud be visible to each user (GUI component) under the repository and project.
- easy way to filter these messages (activities) from the GUI

ps. I've never used JIRA, so if anything is wrong with this ticket (missing story, labels etc.) let me know, I'll fix it, because in my opinion this is must-have-Feature for enterprise repository. There is always someone who wants to control or be able to check who, when and to what get access or made any changes.
fields.summary: Audit logging

fields.description: This can be reproduced by POST/PUTing to a REST URL which only consumes JSON with no body or with a content-type which is not application/json
fields.summary: 415 not correctly returned when unsupported media type is used with REST
Awesomeness.

fields.description:
There are no permalinks on the date/time on the comments.

I would like to copy a link to a comment to send to a fellow reviewer.
fields.summary: Permalink to pull request comments

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of December 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks to everyone for voting and commenting on this suggestion. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Bitbucket Server.

This suggestion is a priority for the Bitbucket development team and is on our roadmap, however we're not able to provide a timeline for when it will be resolved. We have an implementation of emoji support that needs further refinement before it is production-ready. [Learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Cheers,

Norman Ma

Product Manager - Bitbucket Server
{panel}

*Original request description*

Please consider "gitlab-like" markdown with wider emoticon support (see http://www.emoji-cheat-sheet.com/)
Thx
fields.summary: Add support for Emoji icons

fields.description:
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/STASH/repos/stash/pull-requests/3/overview

loaded this page, can't get the dialog to go away.  Click over and over and it just keeps cycling.

j
fields.summary: "Activity not found" dialog cycles over and over
